p: Three molecules with demonstrated pro‐resolving activity may be especially useful in the context of COVID‐19—ANXA1, angiotensin‐(1–7), and plasmin – and these are now discussed in greater detail. For the first, expression of the AnxA1 gene was increased in mice recovering from pneumococcal infection (Tavares et al., 2016) and administration of the ANXA1 peptidomimetic improved severe pneumococcal pneumonia (Machado et al., 2020) and severe influenza. Together with data showing increased expression in recovered COVID‐19 patients, these data suggest that restoration of ANXA1 levels may be useful to treat severe COVID‐19 patients.
